instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI/BIOS LOCK
threads.message:
I have a 2015 MacBook that is EFI locked. I know the process on EFI removal on older Mac's like 2014 MacBook Air, however, I do not know which CHIP holds the info on this Logic Board. If someone would be kind enough to point to the CHIP that does hold the EFI info and what it's identifier is, would be very much appreciated. 

Or maybe give me a clue to what the best way to remove the lock it. I have a TL866CS I use to program with. I usually solder each pin by hand. This Logic Board is different to me because the CHIP I think it is looks to be a BGA EFI CHIP (different style then what I am use to)

Also can someone point me to replacement CHIPS I can purchase for back up purposes?


HAPPY NEW YEAR ALL!!!!!

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI/BIOS LOCK
threads.message:
Yeah, it is BGA, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> SPI chip.
Medusa 2 can help you in this case.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI/BIOS LOCK
threads.message:
Thank you for that info. 

Is it possible to remove the lock with a TL866CS?
